intro: Pimelea glabra, commonly known as the smooth pimelea, is a low-growing shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine, silky coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. Pimelea glabra is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
